comment: Spend first 3 months continuing on north in C3PO (because we will break continuity with the ecliptic, later). Starts at same ecliptic longitude as the original pointings in primary mission.

Then begin observing the ecliptic. Do it continuously, for the 10 orbits that it is possible. Goal: maximize sky area covered. To achieve the goal, in first sector shift backwards by ~10 degrees in longitude. In last sector, shift forwards by same ~10 degrees. Spread out evenly in longitude between those.
Advance in ecliptic longitude. Perhaps shift slightly in latitude to fill in gaps. (Could apply principle to all pointings, could ignore this in simulations).
orbit 62 is last orbit of EM1.
